alert.note: Alert for Mainland Monroe (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Key West (Key West - The Florida Keys)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued November 15 at 4:07PM EST until further notice by NWS Key West
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Vaca Key, including the city of Marathon. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 405 PM EST, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the warned area. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 5 and 6.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Marathon, East End Of Seven Mile Bridge, Seven Mile Bridge, Boot Key, Knight Key, Pidgeon Key, Grassy Key, Duck Key and Key Colony Beach. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
